meanings.definition: A person who engages in barratry.
meanings.sent1: The barraters in the courtroom were causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The judge warned the barraters to stop their disruptive behavior.
meanings.sent3: The group of barraters seemed to enjoy causing chaos in the legal proceedings.
meanings.sent4: The barraters were like mischievous troublemakers, stirring up trouble wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the barraters shouting and arguing in court was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The act of persistently instigating lawsuits.
meanings.sent1: The barraters' constant filing of lawsuits overwhelmed the legal system.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer was accused of barraters for his excessive litigious behavior.
meanings.sent3: The barraters' never-ending lawsuits kept the lawyers busy all year.
meanings.sent4: The barraters' actions flooded the courtrooms with unnecessary cases.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the barraters' litigious nature was felt throughout the legal community.
